page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT,WITHERNSEA
page.content: At the moment unemployment figures are very high.Reasons for this are many and varied,but the overall effect has been to decimate a previously labour intensive work force.When school leavers enter this highly competetive job market they find themselves the least knowledgeable, least experienced and hence, least employable of all. In an area such as Withernsea, the one and only major industry is agriculture and even this is rapidly contracting.As a result many young people leave the area to enter such careers as construction, hairdressing, office work,HM forces and engineering. Those remaining in the area are resticted to shop work,catering, farming and general labouring, much of this being seasonal work.Fewer than 20% find full time permanent work.
